diff --git a/python/sglang/srt/layers/moe/fused_moe_triton/configs/README b/python/sglang/srt/layers/moe/fused_moe_triton/configs/README
index 4aa527f27..3679e698a 100644
--- a/python/sglang/srt/layers/moe/fused_moe_triton/configs/README
+++ b/python/sglang/srt/layers/moe/fused_moe_triton/configs/README
@@ -3,6 +3,9 @@ For different settings of
 - E (number of experts)
 - N (intermediate size)
 - device_name (torch.cuda.get_device_name())
+- dtype: The data type used by the fused MoE kernel for computation. Supported types include fp8_w8a8, int8_w8a8, int8_w8a16, int4_w4a16, etc. This determines the precision and quantization scheme for both weights and activations.
+- block_shape: The block quantization shape introduced starting from DeepSeek V3/R1 models. This parameter defines the granularity for block-wise quantization, typically specified as `[block_n, block_k]` where `block_n` and `block_k` represent the block dimensions. For example, DeepSeek V3 commonly uses `[128, 128]` block shapes for efficient block-wise FP8 quantization.
+
 the JSON file contains a mapping from M (batch size) to the chosen configuration.
 
 The example configurations provided are for the Mixtral model for TP2 on H100

llm_reason: This commit adjusts configuration details for the fused Moe Triton layer by adding a Triton version key (as seen in the JSON configuration file renames and README updates) to help avoid performance decreases with different Triton versions. Although the patch modifies configuration and documentation files rather than core algorithmic code, it is intended to ensure that the high-level API uses the most appropriate configuration for optimal performance on the CPU. The changes are not trivial documentation fixes; they are aimed at making performance less sensitive to the Triton version used. Therefore, despite being implemented through configuration file reorganization, the commit fulfills the criteria for being performance or optimization related.
llm_api_reason: This commit updates the configuration files used by the fused MoE Triton kernel. It adds documentation for new parameters (dtype and block_shape) in the README and reorganizes the JSON config files (by renaming/moving them under a Triton version folder) so that different Triton versions can be distinguished to avoid performance degradation. Since these changes only affect configuration files and not any actual Python API functions or methods, no public Python API is modified.
